Posts.EditableText: i've started making a new rpg that i hope be become a mmorpg 8) . it's the classic fantasy world but with a few twists... 1. 'courage' and 'self-esteem' are stats that effect EVERYTHING you do. 2. when you die you become a ghost and you go to the spirit world, where there are cities and quests to be done, etc. and you can return to the real world as a ghost.... 3. diseases can stack and effect you in strange, un-expected ways... and many more ideas. i'd like to know what people think of these ideas and if they have and ideas they can give me. i have'nt made much yet but it's slowey forming. the playable races are: human, kath (cat-people), highelves, darkelves, hob'en (like hobbits) and shaedows (demonic creatures ). it's also got a day&night cycle and weather system, where places have different discriptions at different times and conditions. i'd like help most with: - fantasy style names for places and people - and any other tips for coding etc. thank you.
Posts.HTML:
i've started making a new rpg that i hope be become a mmorpg 8) . it's the classic fantasy world but with a few twists...

1. 'courage' and 'self-esteem' are stats that effect EVERYTHING you do.
2. when you die you become a ghost and you go to the spirit world, where there are cities and quests to be done, etc. and you can return to the real world as a ghost....
3. diseases can stack and effect you in strange, un-expected ways...

and many more ideas. i'd like to know what people think of these ideas and if they have and ideas they can give me. i have'nt made much yet but it's slowey forming. the playable races are: human, kath (cat-people), highelves, darkelves, hob'en (like hobbits) and shaedows (demonic creatures ).

it's also got a day&night cycle and weather system, where places have different discriptions at different times and conditions.

i'd like help most with:
- fantasy style names for places and people
- and any other tips for coding etc.

thank you.

Posts.EditableText: Sounds like a cool idea, but really hard, if you have different cycles and weather patterns that change room descriptions. Maybe it would be easier if you, instead of having day/night cycles and letting the players move back to rooms that you would need to change descriptions, would have day/night cycles, but in different parts of the game. Sounds confusing, but here's what I mean: Let's say you have a "Mansion," and the rooms are "Room1," Room2," and "Room3." And let's say you have a timer that after 2 minutes changes "Day" to "Night." Now, you would need to program the rooms so that if the player enters room, if timerx is on, display "daydescription." Otherwise, display "nightdescription." My idea is to have the whole time in the mansion be daytime, so you don't need to change descriptions based on day or night, but after the player completes that part of the mansion, move them to a deifferent part of the game, say, "the Basement," and say that now it is night. What I mean may be a little (or a lot) unclear, but I hope you undertand what I'm saying. Anyway, that's what I would do if I was making a game like that. As for help with fantasy-style names and places, if you'd like I can give you some. I read lots of fantasy books (Stephen King's "The Dark Tower" being my num. 1 fave series of all time) and have a feeling for weird names.

You forgot to do anything when you gave the player the weapon choice... All it did was give a message, then move on to the next option.

I've put a string there, and set that to whatever weapon you choose... I've also replaced the if's, so instead of "if got" (if the player has an object) it is if ( # = # ) (if string equals value/other string).

Anyway, I've sent it back. I like some of that... Nice.

Posts.EditableText:
I think you can change it to hexadecimal HTML-like code colours now.
So instead of |cbl (or whatever) you can type |x0000FF ... Although I have no idea about this.

This is taken straight from the Quest help file:
[code:1spmv1tn]Code     Text formatting  
|b     bold on
|xb     bold off
|u     underline
|xu     underline off
|i     italic
|xi     italic off
|cb     black, or current foreground colour
|cr     red
|cl     blue
|cy     yellow
|cg     green
|sxx     change font size to xx - anything from 01 to 99
|s00     revert to default font size
|jl     set text to left-justified
|jc     set text to centered
|jr     set text to right-justified
|n     new line
|xn     (at end of msg text only) no new line
|w     wait for keypress
|c     clear screen
[/code:1spmv1tn]
Notice the "or foreground colour". So |cb is foreground colour. I'm guessing if it already is foreground colour it changes to black.

This is taken straight from the Quest help file:
Code     Text formatting  
|b     bold on
|xb     bold off
|u     underline
|xu     underline off
|i     italic
|xi     italic off
|cb     black, or current foreground colour
|cr     red
|cl     blue
|cy     yellow
|cg     green
|sxx     change font size to xx - anything from 01 to 99
|s00     revert to default font size
|jl     set text to left-justified
|jc     set text to centered
|jr     set text to right-justified
|n     new line

|w     wait for keypress
|c     clear screen

Notice the "or foreground colour". So |cb is foreground colour. I'm guessing if it already is foreground colour it changes to black.

Posts.EditableText:
The HTML-style RRGGBB syntax applies only to "foreground" and "background" commands/tags, e.g. foreground <&H0030FF> has 00 red, 30 green and FF blue.

These commands set the default foreground and background colours. When I say that "|cb" means "black, or current foreground colour", that means that "|cb" is usually black, because black is the default foreground colour. If the default foreground colour has been changed, then "|cb" will set the colour to that foreground colour which was specified.

Hope this makes sense - one of my many planned features on the ever-growing "to do" list is to add support for HTML-style tags within parameters for text formatting, so you'd be able to use msg <[colour=0030FF]Blah blah blah[/colour]> or something along those lines.
Posts.HTML:
The HTML-style RRGGBB syntax applies only to "foreground" and "background" commands/tags, e.g. foreground <&H0030FF> has 00 red, 30 green and FF blue.

These commands set the default foreground and background colours. When I say that "|cb" means "black, or current foreground colour", that means that "|cb" is usually black, because black is the default foreground colour. If the default foreground colour has been changed, then "|cb" will set the colour to that foreground colour which was specified.

Hope this makes sense - one of my many planned features on the ever-growing "to do" list is to add support for HTML-style tags within parameters for text formatting, so you'd be able to use msg <[colour=0030FF]Blah blah blah[/colour]> or something along those lines.

Posts.EditableText: Hi there. Well, what kind of name are you looking for for the snake things? Are you looking for a name that applies to them, physically, like "The hissers," because they hiss, or something that just sounds mystical,, like "the Dethombres?" In either case, I thought up a few for each. Sorry if they are bad; I'm thinking them up on the spot. Anyway, here they are: [b:23f0rynu][u:23f0rynu]Physical Names:[/u:23f0rynu][/b:23f0rynu] 1. The Dark Slitherers. 2. The race of Horror Hissers 3. Slythering Temptation 4. Tongues of Evil 5. The Snake Lords 6. Beasts of darkness [b:23f0rynu][u:23f0rynu]Mystical-Sounding Names[/u:23f0rynu][/b:23f0rynu] 1. Derathegom 2. Shwendarti 3. Hissfardethon 4. Kindelik 5. Bevernlees 6. Hatephar Don't laugh at those. Are you looking for a name that applies to them, physically, like "The hissers," because they hiss, or something that just sounds mystical,, like "the Dethombres?" In either case, I thought up a few for each. Sorry if they are bad; I'm thinking them up on the spot. Anyway, here they are:

Physical Names:
1. The Dark Slitherers.
2. The race of Horror Hissers
3. Slythering Temptation
4. Tongues of Evil
5. The Snake Lords
6. Beasts of darkness

Mystical-Sounding Names
1. Derathegom
2. Shwendarti
3. Hissfardethon
4. Kindelik
5. Bevernlees
6. Hatephar

Don't laugh at those. They have no meaning whatsoever, but I thought they sounded cool. If you need more, I'm sure I can call up some new ones from my insane imagination. lol. Anyway, tell me if you like any.

Posts.EditableText:
A couple of things.  Yes, I don't get such a long term in June/July/August.  We get a 10 week term maximum here, even in private schools.  Our holidays start around about the 10th of December, and end near the end of January.  However, at my school this year, we get three weeks off instead of two weeks like public schools.  So basically, for the standard school here, it's four 10 week terms, two week holidays in between, and a six-week summer holiday.

Oh, and Zelimos, you might want to change your signiature.  You've been Zelimos for over a month now, you've even changed your avatar, but your sig still says "Ste".
